page.title: 04Coniston Water & Grizedale
page.content: {LAKE AND LAKE MARGIN} Coniston Water is the major single feature of this block. Overall, the lake is nearly 9km long. The average width of the northern 3km is 500m. Two{streams enter the lake less than 300m apart. They are{Yewdale Beck}and{Church Beck. The{lake margin}is predominantly agricultural land with public access, particularly on the W shore. The {shoreline}is mostly pebbly beach, greatly exposed in dry weather. Behind the shoreline the lake wears, in most places, a fringe of scrub woodland, particularly{willow}and{alder. { {FOREST} On the E side of the lake, ancient coppice woods rise to the W edge of{Grizedale Forest,}a vast tract of coniferous plantation on former moorland. The main species are:{Norway {Spruce, Sitka Spruce}and{Larch.
